answers.answer: Congrats!!!!   I'm so happy that everything turned out okay!
So great to hear about baby sara!!! Can't wait to meet her!

Congrats-Everyone is having their babies and it makes me want mine out so bad!-December can't come soon enough..Meanwhile I am enjoying this pregnancy so much more than last time!I am so happy for you that everything is going well. She sounds so tiny and adorable! Congrats again on the baby girl!
Congrats on your little miracle!  Are they going to need to keep the baby longer?  Or are you both home?  And the Epidural still scares the hell outta me!  lol
Oops-I see now...baby Sara!  My 5 yo DD is dying to name our baby Sara!  :)
Congratulations on the birth of your baby girl!  What did you name her?
Congratulations on your little princess.I wish you both a speedy recovery.Hope the nursing takes off and you are both able to go home soon.
Congratulations!   She sure is tiny.  Hope you can find something for her to wear.

I posted on the August moms thread but just in case you don't see it.....CONGRATULATIONS! :)  I'll bet she's just adorable! And if clothes are an issue (have 2 kids brought that up) they have absolutely adorable preemie stuff at Wal Mart! Cheyenne's little guy was wearing those clothes at 4 pounds! :)

Aw congrats on baby!  My friend they were wrong on the size too.  She is 8 weeks older than my son and she was 7 lbs. when he was born, he was just under 9 lbs.  She's just so tiny and petite.  Made the clothes last longer too.  I bet she's beautiful!  Rest up and enjoy.
Congratulations on the baby girl.  She sounds so tiny!  I am glad both you and her are doing well.

Congrats!!!  How are you feeling overall?  Are you in much pain?  They are probably giving you plenty of pain meds though!  So her lungs are mature?  Do you think you will be able to bring baby Sara home on Friday also?  Do they have her in the room with you, or is she in the NICU?Again congratulations!!  Enjoy your little one!   I love then name you picked btw!!  If my son would have been a girl, we were going to name her either Sara or Savanna.

Congratulations!!!  My DD was born at 36 week two years ago, she was 7lbs 5 ozs!  Mine must have been a horse!! :)  I am so glad it went well, and good luck with everything... and I agree, those nurses are amazing!!  I couldn't have gotten through it without them, and the spinal wasn't bad AT ALL,  I was so scared about that part!!  Again, congrats!!

Congrats!!! Ditto to what ruby said.  Premie stuff from WalMart are the coolest.  DD was born at 37 weeks and she was tiny too (5 lbs 7 oz).  Preemie was the way to go for us.  They grow up fast.  She'll be 10 months soon and weighs approximately 20 lbs now.  Hard to believe but when I look at the pix, I remember how scared I was that she would break or something LOL...Good luck and come back with any questions you might have.

her lungs are mature. dr said probably because she was being stressed from all of the medical complications. apparently stress makes the lungs mature faster. she's in a regular nursery, and can room in with us. hasn't yet, since the first night i was being observed and in L&D instead of mother/baby ward. last night i was still too medicated and tired. she's been with us all day, but i may send her back to nursery so we can sleepas far as nursing... she's too sleepy and small to latch on, so when it comes to feeding they;re treating her like a preemie. i just tried pumping, and we actually got something, so at least i know she'll get the nourishment she needs.as far as pain... i've felt better, but it's not unbearable. i'm alternating motrin and percoset (no more morphine:) i can walk around, but bending is not gonna happen for a while. dr said today should be the worst as far as pain, and it should get better after this point.thanks for the pointers on preemie clothes. nothing we bought fits!ImmortalOne- my understanding is that the epidural is similar in procedure to spinal. i had a terrible, authentic needle phobia prior to this pregnancy. i've gotten very good and learned many self-relaxation techniques, but i still don't like needles. the spinal was far from the worst part. like i said, to me, getting the IV was worse! there was definitely no pain associated with getting the spinal. it;s exactly as they say. you feel the ***** from the local anesthetic, then all you feel is pressure when they give you the actual spinal. in fact, mine was done by a resident instead of the doctor (teaching hospital). i could have insisted on the attending, but everyone was so reassuring, including my doctor who was right there, that i agreed.thanks for your comments, thoughts, and prayers. we all hope to go home friday!

question: Hi everyone! Turns out I had preeclampsia and we had to have an emergency c-section on monday. i was 36 weeks. in addition to my high blood pressure and edema, i had a lot of protein in my urine. when i got to the hospital on monday, the protein levels were +4. luckily, my platelet levels had gone up a little since friday, so we were able to do a spinal instead of general anesthesia. sonogram monday morning showed that the placenta had continued to age since we last saw it on thursday, so even if my blood and urine tests had been better, we would have had to deliver in the next week. last thursday she was estimated to weigh 5 lbs 6 oz, but she was born 4 lbs 13 oz. she's tiny! but she's doing very well!!! the only trouble she is having is slight difficulty regulating body temp. we haven't had success breast feeding yet, but i will meet with the lactation specialist today. because of my high bp, i had to spend an extra 24 hrs on the L&D floor for careful monitoring and to receive meds to prevent seizures. (by the way... i heard magnesium sulfate is supposed to be pretty rough, but i tolerated it very well... only side effect was being a little flushed). all of the meds had me very out of it, so dh spent more time with the baby than i did.i am now in a regular mother/baby unit, and hope to spend more time with her today. she sleeps a lot, so it's very calming. in fact, everytime i try to bf, she just passes out. if all goes well, we'll heqd home friday, after which i am sure i will post many questions about infant care!!Notes about my delivery:~labor and delivery and maternity nurses are AMAZING people~getting spinal was not too bad! (and this is coming from someone with a needle phobia). i personally felt more uncomfortable getting the IV put in
title: update: baby Sara born at 36 weeks
